p: Both the number and the area of the oil glands are statistically different between non-galled leaves and galls. The density of the glands per mm 2 was higher in galls than in non-galled leaves ( p < 0.0001) (Figure 3A), and the area of the glands was larger and more variable ( p = 0.0227) in galls than in non-galled leaves (Figure 3B).
